channel.title: Free vs Steam version
channel.description:
Can you please explain to me what will be the differences between the (new) free version and the paid version of Black Mesa?
Are there graphical improvements (what kind of?) or are also the xen levels going to be exclusive?
Thanks!

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
GordonFreeManz:

I just have to say this right now, I’d say everyone here should get the Steam version. I understand the mod is supposed to be free. But these developers have put SO MUCH blood, tears, and sweat into this mod… and everyone just downloads it for free? I understand some people don’t have the money. But this is a labor of love to the fans. And yet we still have people asking “Where’s Xen? Where’s Xen?” can’t anyone just appreciate that we are getting a remake of a masterpiece?

I understand all of the impatience for Xen. But please understand the developers are busy tweaking the game to be awesome, like adding multiplayer, fixing bugs, and adding a bunch of stuff.

Xen can wait honestly. If you guys want it to be rushed out, then you obviously don’t understand it from their perspective.

You see I like Apple more than Microsoft. Hear me out, Apple produces good-quality products (at least when Steve Jobs was CEO. Not sure about how Tim Cook or John Scully are doing…)

Microsoft produces 3rd-rate products. Can I tell you why? Because Microsoft cares more about the sales and marketing and less about the content/product/consumer.

Apple cares about the content/product/consumer first.

Or for example, how the COD devs are literally the worst since they could already have a full game but instead like to split off little portions to create “DLC” that they can profit off of.

And don’t get me started on EA…

Point is, if all of you people here want Xen so soon.

Ask yourself this question, do you want to play a rushed piece of shit?

Or do you want to play a really good experience that will last with you for a while. Xen should be beautiful. Because it’s a beautiful finale to such a beautiful masterpiece.

Patience is a virtue. Can’t anyone just wait for Xen to come out? Can people please stop bugging the devs so much about Xen?

Don’t you know they have more important issues on their hands right now? Like the fact that they have a real-life, and a real job, and some of them have real families and stuff? Can’t anyone give them a break? I mean it is the holidays and stuff and everyone is just… I don’t know.

I am patient. And I am proud to say that the Black Mesa Team is awesome, and that everything they are doing right now is awesome, and I give all of them a big hug and kiss on the cheek.

They deserve money folks. They are doing this for us and for everyone.

They deserve to work at VALVE…

They are fucking awesome.

Do you understand?

They are amazing, they deserve more than just a free download.

I’m sorry I sound a little brash blunt or rude…

But I’m just so sick’n tired of all of the comments asking where’s Xen and stuff. And I’ve just seen so much shit on the forums of people bugging the devs about Xen that I just had it up to here.

Now then…

That’s all I have to say. I know I don’t post that much, but that’s because I don’t get on that much.

Anyway, God bless the Black Mesa devs.

And mostly, I love you Black Mesa Developer Team! Keep up the good work!

<3

Most of the fans of Black Mesa will probably buy it when it comes out but there will still be a free version for people that don’t want to buy it. (don’t know why they wouldn’t)

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
And we love you too GordanFreeManz <3

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
Stay on topic please fellas.

This sums it up best:

Dotard:

Why does it even matter that it won’t be “officially” included, since everyone who wants it there can simply download those mods and add them?

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Actually I find ST Uncut perfect and for OaR Uncut, it’s soooooo good, except the outdoor area. Yes, it’s pretty and yes, it adds a more open gameplay to Black Mesa’s mostly linear combat, but getting shot from every possible angle and from 2 miles range and from a tower isn’t fun, it’s frustrating. But rather than the map itself being to blame, I guess that’s the fault of BM’s soldier AI and configuration. If anything, I’d get rid of the sniper as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I’m actually glad, because sans a freaking incredible part of OaR Uncut, I don’t think they were worth adding.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

All I want to see is proper HECU AI.

We were told about it 2 years ago.

Still dosen’t make it any less disappointing.

Also the Hecu AI while not perfect is still miles ahead of the combine AI in Half-Life 2.

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: mr_StevenS
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

I will endeavor to convert and recompile/repackage everything to make it compatible with retail, and on the workshop - hopefully for day 1. If not, then hopefully reasonably soon.

Day-one DLC confirmed

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: your-name-here
item.description:
One thing of note: Because we have access to all of VALVe’s publicly released games, we can (and have) ripped all sorts of optimizations out from them and ported them into our engine. This is simply not legally possible with the free version.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

Not sure about the new free version but retail now has an optional “auto crouch jump” feature. I was actually one of the team members hugely in support of crouch jumping the way it was in our mod, but the auto crouch jump has totally won me over. It’s so good.

No, it will not. And they will not be integrated, as per both the team’s wishes and my own wishes.

I will endeavor to convert and recompile/repackage everything to make it compatible with retail, and on the workshop - hopefully for day 1. If not, then hopefully reasonably soon.

It’s a little disappointing to hear they won’t include on a rail uncut or surface tension uncut but at least you’re going to convert them to them for the steam release.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: yrr
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

I will endeavor to convert and recompile/repackage everything to make it compatible with retail, and on the workshop - hopefully for day 1. If not, then hopefully reasonably soon.

thanks a bunch, that sounds bloody awesome ! I guess I will try it with and without but just knowing that there is the option to expand the retail is already a comforting thought…

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
coldroll:

You mean the jump height right? You can easily fix that by changing these skill.cfg files to 200.

bms_normal_jump_vertical_speed “120”
bms_normal_jump_crouch_vertical_speed “120”

Not sure about the new free version but retail now has an optional “auto crouch jump” feature. I was actually one of the team members hugely in support of crouch jumping the way it was in our mod, but the auto crouch jump has totally won me over. It’s so good.

Lavalampdrinker:

Will the paid version be compatible with the 3rd party mods such as On The Rail Uncut and Surface Tension Uncut? Or even better Is there a chance these could be integrated? U t would be awesome if you consider that guys.

No, it will not. And they will not be integrated, as per both the team’s wishes and my own wishes.

I will endeavor to convert and recompile/repackage everything to make it compatible with retail, and on the workshop - hopefully for day 1. If not, then hopefully reasonably soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
The paid version will be using the source 2011 or source 2013 engine so I don’t know if any existing mods will be compatible with it. Maybe one of the devs could answer this question?

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I think the ‘jump’ thing was even addressed in the mod version if I remember correctly?

You mean the jump height right? You can easily fix that by changing these skill.cfg files to 200.

bms_normal_jump_vertical_speed “120”
bms_normal_jump_crouch_vertical_speed “120”

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I think the ‘jump’ thing was even addressed in the mod version if I remember correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: bkdale86
item.description:
As far as I know you can have both steam game and mod on the same machine. I have both currently and there is no conflict. They are different engines and don’t “share” files.
As far as patches to both …There have been a lot of bugs that were fixed and other improvements for the mod version. I think once that is released that is it for the mod version. If you want fixes after that its the steam version you will want.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
Oh oops sorry I thought they were done by you as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Thank you kindly sir… however my contribution includes the tram system and the overhead announcements. The scientist was done by Lurana Hillard; Mike Hillard’s mom. (Gotta keep the scientists in the family ya know. )

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I think perhaps that is probably the hardest part about this whole project. I see the dev team working furiously every. dad. gum. splendiferous. day, but of course the public doesn’t see it. We all totally get why folks might wonder if there really is movement going on, and we wont begrudge a fan if they poke their head in once in a while to ask of all is well.

But yes… all is well, every day there is work being done, and I don’t see anyone slowing down. :3

Oh and by the way this is a little off topic but I thought your voice acting for the female scientists and black ops as well as the announcement system was really top notch.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
coldroll:

That’s great I can’t wait to play Black Mesa with the bug fixes and it’s great to hear significant progress has been made! Also I didn’t ask about Xen since it’s obviously not coming out for a while.

I think perhaps that is probably the hardest part about this whole project. I see the dev team working furiously every. dad. gum. splendiferous. day, but of course the public doesn’t see it. We all totally get why folks might wonder if there really is movement going on, and we wont begrudge a fan if they poke their head in once in a while to ask of all is well.

But yes… all is well, every day there is work being done, and I don’t see anyone slowing down. :3

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
DaftMink:

Have their been any patches made public to the current release of Black Mesa to fix the more annoying bugs like the broken Mortar Map and Garg AI in surface tension and the extreme lag when loading a Lamda core save?. While screenshots of newly remodeled props are fun to look at it doesn’t help those who want replay black mesa in it’s current form.

You’ll just have to wait until after the steam version is released.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vs Steam version
item.dc:creator: DaftMink
item.description:
CatzEyes93:
  1. The “retail” release or Steam version (yes, you will finally get to throw us some change) is is going to have upgrades, bug fixes, a multiplayer addon, and a port to a new engine. That said, because it is a steam version, this also means that any additional fixes or add ons after the initial launch can be done on the fly. No more sending you off to other websites to download patches or upgrade to newer versions. That is the beauty of Steam that we all appreciate.

Have their been any patches made public to the current release of Black Mesa to fix the more annoying bugs like the broken Mortar Map and Garg AI in surface tension and the extreme lag when loading a Lamda core save?. While screenshots of newly remodeled props are fun to look at it doesn’t help those who want replay black mesa in it’s current form.

Read full topic
